alert.note: Alert for Bourbon (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 9:48PM EST until January 02 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Stoner Creek at Paris affecting Bourbon County. .Heavy rain from the past 24 hours will cause the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stoner Creek at Paris. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water floods a few low roads on right bank of creek. At 20.0 feet, Water enter yards of homes downstream of water plant. Parts of the Garrard Park flood. At 22.0 feet, Water in the yards of homes along Taylor, Chambers, Stoner Avenues and Catherine Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM EST Saturday the stage was 16.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this afternoon to 20.9 feet just after midnight tonight and then gradually decrease. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 30.0 feet on 03/02/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. If you are affected by these crests take any necessary actions. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index. php?wfo=lmk Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning.
